snippet: The offering, which at the midpoint would raise more than $300 million, would provide a nice exit for the luggage maker's controlling shareholder, Doughty Hanson, a London-based private equity firm that acquired the company in 2004.
abstract: The offering, which at the midpoint would raise more than $300 million, would provide a nice exit for the luggage maker's controlling shareholder, Doughty Hanson, a London-based private equity firm that acquired the company in 2004.

headline.main: Tumi Sets I.P.O. Price Range at $15 to $17
